articles.author: Emily Atkinson
articles.title: Majority of Tory voters now want Johnson to quit, YouGov poll suggests
articles.description: Number of Britons in favour of PM reached record high of 69 per cent
articles.content: The majority of Conservative voters and two thirds of Britons think Boris Johnson should resign as prime minister after a series of high-profile government resignations shook his premiership, a poll … [+2024 chars]

articles.author: Rob Merrick
articles.title: Boris Johnson fights for political life after twin cabinet resignations over Chris Pincher scandal
articles.description: Disintegration of cabinet dramatically cuts odds on prime minister being forced out
articles.content:
Boris Johnson is clinging to power by a thread after the twin resignations of his chancellor and health secretary over the Chris Pincher scandal plunged him into his biggest crisis yet. 
The disinte… [+5497 chars]

articles.author: Editorial
articles.title: Boris Johnson must go – and leave Downing Street with whatever dignity he can muster
articles.description: Editorial: A quiet exit would be preferable with near-immediate effect, with the deputy prime minister, Dominic Raab, or some other caretaker allowed to take over until a new leader emerges or is elected
articles.content:
After the resignations of Sajid Javid and Rishi Sunak, two of the more serious and substantial figures in his lightweight cabinet, the prime ministers government has entered the terminal stage. 
The… [+536 chars]

articles.author: Tom Peck
articles.title: I wouldn’t put anything past Boris Johnson – he may stay, he may go, he may just run for the hills
articles.description: Who, at this point, would bet against Johnson actively trying to run the country from some kind of gold-wallpapered bivouac while on the run from law enforcement?
articles.content: Maybe, in hindsight, the clues were there. Maybe, if you look again at those pictures from round the cabinet table on Tuesday morning, the entire government looking like theyve ABBA hologrammed in fr… [+3991 chars]

articles.author: Ashley Cowburn
articles.title: Conservative Party vice chairman resigns live on air saying he ‘can’t serve’ under Boris Johnson
articles.description: PM doesn’t have ‘the support of the party, or indeed the country any more,’ MP says
articles.content:
The Conservative Partys vice chairman Bim Afolami has resigned from his position live on air, saying Boris Johnson no longer has the support of the country.
His comments came just moments after the … [+1614 chars]

articles.author: Sean O'Grady
articles.title: It’s finally over for Boris Johnson – those who work most closely with the PM have given up on him
articles.description: There’s no doubt fresh leadership will revitalise the government, but the old challenges – like Brexit – will remain
articles.content:
Its over. So the dam has broken at last. Its strange the way this game of consequences plays out. The albino greased piglet is well and truly stuck, an apple firmly rammed in his gob. Et tu, Rishi?
… [+4886 chars]

articles.title: Sean O'Grady | The Independent
articles.description: The latest breaking news, comment and features from The Independent.
articles.content: Sean O'Grady is the Associate Editor of the Independent. He writes editorials, columns about politics and economics, and reviews, including television and cars. He has worked for our titles since 199… [+141 chars]

articles.author: Harriet Williamson
articles.title: John Peel’s legacy has been tarnished by sex allegations – of course his Glastonbury stage should be renamed
articles.description: Someone who openly spoke about assaulting children has been honoured, over and over again, in their lifetime and in the years after their death, because they had a good career in broadcasting
articles.content: A petition has been launched to remove the name of former BBC Radio 1 presenter John Peel from one of the main Glastonbury Festival tents. Peel, dubbed the most important man in music for about a doz… [+3943 chars]

articles.author: Hamish McRae
articles.title: What is happening to the global housing market – and what comes next?
articles.description: The broad global picture is that the massive surge in property prices is coming to an end, writes Hamish McRae
articles.content:
House prices worldwide are starting to plateau and maybe fall. So what is happening in the different markets? And what is likely to happen next?
Those questions probably affect more people than just… [+781 chars]
